PATIENT CLINICAL NOTE

Age Group: 50-59 years
Visit Type: Follow-up appointment

PRIMARY DIAGNOSIS: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

CHIEF COMPLAINT AND HISTORY:
Patient reports polyuria, polydipsia, and recent weight loss. Blood glucose levels elevated at 180-220 mg/dL fasting.

CURRENT MEDICATIONS:
  • Insulin Glargine 20 units QHS
  • Glipizide 5mg daily

VITAL SIGNS (Current Visit):
  • Blood Pressure: 130/77 mmHg
  • Heart Rate: 70 bpm
  • Temperature: 98.7°F
  • Oxygen Saturation: 96% on room air
  • Respiratory Rate: 17 breaths/min

PHYSICAL EXAMINATION:
  • General: Alert and oriented, appears stated age, in no acute distress
  • Cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, no murmurs, rubs, or gallops
  • Respiratory: Clear to auscultation bilaterally, no wheezes or crackles
  • Extremities: No cyanosis, clubbing, or edema noted

ASSESSMENT AND PLAN:
Continue current diabetic regimen. Increase metformin to 1000mg BID. Patient counseled on carbohydrate counting and portion control. HbA1c ordered for next visit.

PATIENT EDUCATION:
Patient demonstrates understanding of treatment plan and medication regimen. Warning signs discussed. Patient instructed to call or present to ED for any concerning symptoms.

FOLLOW-UP: Scheduled for 2 weeks
